name: FanBridge signup
author: FanBridge Inc.

sections.description:
The FanBridge Signup plugin allows you to add an email signup form to your WordPress blog. The form automatically adds signups to your FanBridge account.

Not using FanBridge? Learn more about how FanBridge helps you grow, engage, and monetize your fan base.

After installing the FanBridge Signup plugin, you’ll be able to enter your account ID and customize your form under the settings menu in WordPress. Setup takes less than 5 minutes and doesn’t require any file editing. Download, customize, and get more fans!
sections.installation:
This section describes how to install the plugin and get it working.

  1. Unzip and upload the entire fanbridge-signup folder to the /wp-content/plugins/ directory
  2. Activate the plugin through the ‘Plugins’ menu in WordPress
  3. Go to Settings and look for “FanBridge Signup” in the menu
  4. Enter your FanBridge User ID.
  5. Customize your form with additional appearance and data field options
  6. Go to Appearance->Widgets and drag the FanBridge Signup Widget widget into one of your Widget Areas
  7. Enjoy!
sections.faq:
What is FanBridge?

FanBridge is the leading Fan Relationship Management platform. We help entertainers, brands, and small businesses grow, engage, and monetize their fan bases through email and social media. Currently, we have over 120 million fans under management.

Want to know exactly what FanBridge can do for you? Visit our site.

Is it free?

We offer a free trial that you can learn about here.

Where do I find my User ID?

Your User ID can be found by logging into your FanBridge account and clicking the My Account link in the top left corner. Your User ID will be at the top of the page. Please double check that your ID is correct, as this determines which account your signups go to.

  • Avoid function name redefinition
  • Fixed error for some PHP hosting with short_open_tag directive eq false

0.2

  • Added additional data fields: Country, State/Region, City
  • Fixed small CSS issue that prevented to see written text in the fields for some themes

0.1

  • Initial release
